page.title: 02EDUCATION IN GREAT BENTLEY
page.content: {GREAT BENTLEY COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL } CATERS FOR YOUNG CHILDREN FROM THE AGE OF FIVE TO ELEVEN FROM THE SURROUNDING VILLAGES OF THORRINGTON, LITTLE BENTLEY,FRATING AND AINGERS GREEN. PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN OFTEN ATTEND ONE OF THE PRIVATE PLAY SCHOOL IN THE AREA.ON COMPLETION OF THEIR PRIMARY EDUCATION THE MAJORITY OF CHILDREN ATTEND THE COLNE HIGH SCHOOL IN BRIGHTLINGSEA UNTIL THEY ARE 16 OR 18. OTHERS MAY GO TO TENDRING HIGH SCHOOL AT THORPE. IF THEY HAVE PASSED THE '11+'SELECTION TEST THEY MIGHT ATTEND ONE OF TGE SELECTIVE GRAMMAR SCHOOLS IN NEARBY COLCHESTER WHERE SCHOOLS OF RELIGIOUS DENOMINATIONS ARE AVAILABLE. NIGHT SCHOOL FACILITIES EXIST LOCALLY AS DO DAY-TIME COLLEGE COURSES. UNIVERSITY FACILITIES ARE ONLY FOUND OUT OF THE AREA.
